journal_entry: The wind West North West. and the termometer 10 degrees above zero. On board the Sehr A.G. Brooks with Capt Thomas Smallidge lying at Sr Andruws N. B and loading with frozen herring for Boston. Took in 30000 in morning which finished the load Gor underway 9.30 am got to Eastport at noon set-the Supercargo a show and filled water and went out. at dark flood tide made and anchored in little River

At one oclock in the morning went out of Little River with the wind very moderate North West and the Thermomemert at 12 above at daylight abrest of Moosepeak. all the forenoon very moderate calm Got abrest of Schoodic Island frost after dark and took the wind from the West and anchord in Winter Harbor at 9 PM

At one oclock in the morning went out of Little River with the wind very moderate North West and the Thermomemert at 12 above at daylight abrest of Moosepeak. all the forenoon very moderate calm Got abrest of Schoodic Island frost after dark and took the wind from the West and anchord in Winter Harbor at 9 PM

Calm in morning Got underway in morning at Winter Harbor for Boston The wind breezed ufi from the West fresh breeze Thermometer at 30 degreese slight snow squalls anchored at North East Harbor at 4 oclock in the after noon In the morning cloued rofi

Anchord at 1 oclock am Wind North East and at 4 oclock in the morning is was snowing very hard and snowed until noon ave lay te an anchorin Portland Rodes. In afternoon drizzling rainThermometer 32 above zero.

Calm in the morning & at 8.30 oclock A.M. the wind breezed up from the Westward. Got under way passed Cape Elizabeth at 10 stood in shore and when stovel we singlereefed at 4 P.M passed Cape Parpoise at 4 Boon Island at 11.30 PM passed Thatehes Island the wind hauling from the North West and growing cold the vessel ??????????? Thermometer 10 above

Calm in the morning & at 8.30 oclock A.M. the wind breezed up from the Westward. Got under way passed Cape Elizabeth at 10 stood in shore and when stovel we singlereefed at 4 P.M passed Cape Parpoise at 4 Boon Island at 11.30 PM passed Thatehes Island the wind hauling from the North West and growing cold the vessel ??????????? Thermometer 10 above

The wind continue to blow from the North West and at 5 oclock in the morning anchored above Long Island in Boston Harbor. and after Sunrise took a tug boat and towed to Commercial Wharf and took out 32 baskets of herring The Thermometer in the Sun at noon 40 above zero. and at night went doen 15 20 above
The wind baffling from North to Easterly and apart after time over east at 9 P.M it was snowing moderately. Thermometer 22 degreese above. Lying at Commercial Wharf ready to dicsharge herring
The wind Easterly & heavy rain allday raining from early in the morning untill in the evening. could not take out any herring Thermometer 32 degrees above zero
The wind Northerly and wind moderate and the Thermometer 24 high in the forenoon took out 16,000 herring during the day.
Wind Northerly and the Thermometer 22 degrees in the morning and went up to 29. took out 20,000 of herring out of the A. G. Brooks.
The wind South West. Thermometer 33 degrees high in the shade Took out of the vessel 17,300 herrings Made top for the vessels pump

The wind Southerly Thermometer 36 degrees high and over cast took out 12,000 herring In the afternoon rainy put hateheo out  made pump brake at 8 oclock in the Evening wind came of North West and Thermometer fell to freezing.

The wind North west Thermometer 11 degrees above zero in the morning Took out of the Schr A. G. Brookss 21,500 herring in the forenoon. In the afternoon done nothing towards discharging and lying along. side of Commercial Wharf Boston.

The wind Southerly and moderate Thermometer in the morning being 20 degrees above zero Wrote letter home and to Chicago Lying at Commercial wharf Boston Went to the Seamens Bethel Hanover street in the evening
Wind moderate N. W. Thermometer 35 degrees at noon Took out of the Schr AGBrooks 17,400 of herring. In the evening to a Gospell Temperance meeting at the Seamens Bethel on Hanover Street
Wind Westerly thermometer 27 Took 15,900 herring out of the Brooks Put fashion piece on Port side of vessel
The wind South West Thermometer 32 at 10 oclock in the fore noon got all out the fore hold and commenced snowing cleared up at night got out 14,900 herring
The wind N.W. by W. Thermometer 22 and clear Took out 5,600 herring put chock on A.G.Brooks.

The wind Easterly and overcast Thermometer 30 degrees Took 20,500 herring out the vessel At noon commenced snowing and put the hatches on no more herring to come out for the day. at night the wind increased to a very heavy gale
The wind hauled around from North to West. Took 14,800 herring out of the vessel in forenoon. In the evening went to a Temperanee meeting at the North End missiogs Thermometer 31 above zero.
The wind North West Thermometer 24 above zero at night colder Went to Religious meeting at Tremont Temple on Tremont Street
Wind North Westerly Thermometer 12 degrees above zero Took out 20,000 herring
The wind Westerly Thermometer 27 above zero. Took out of the Schr A.G. Brooks 25,600 herring

The wind West Thermometer 32 degrees above zeor at Commercial Wharf Took out 33,000 herring out of the vessel which finished the discharginng it being all that was left in yesterday. Towed to the Elevaton in East Boston at dark to take in some corn to be landed at Winter Harbor.

Took in 500 bushels of corn in the forenoon and went out for home The wind from teh N. W. blowing heavy. after getting clear from Boston Harbor Two peefed mainsail and foresail and went into Gloucester at 1 P.M. blowing very heavy Thermometer. 15 above 0 anchored in outer part of Harbor

Took in 500 bushels of corn in the forenoon and went out for home The wind from teh N. W. blowing heavy. after getting clear from Boston Harbor Two peefed mainsail and foresail and went into Gloucester at 1 P.M. blowing very heavy Thermometer. 15 above 0 anchored in outer part of Harbor

The wind North West and blowing a perfect gale with the Thermometer at zero at Sunrise Made no attempt to get underway Layed at ancher all day in Gloucester vessels came in with broken booms and leed very badly.
The wind still blowing a heavy gale from the North West while the Thermometer at day light was only 4 degrees above zero Layed at anchor allday in Gloucester Harbor

The wind Nort W. by W.Thermometer 12 degrees above in morning at 8 A.M. Got under way and went out and went inside of Thatcher Island to Silvages Wind blowing very heavy. and rough vessel staid  wore ship and reefed down and went back to Gloucester at night more moderate.

The wind Nort W. by W.Thermometer 12 degrees above in morning at 8 A.M. Got under way and went out and went inside of Thatcher Island to Silvages Wind blowing very heavy. and rough vessel staid  wore ship and reefed down and went back to Gloucester at night more moderate.
The wind North Thermometer 20 degrees at 10 oclock A.M. Went out and got as fas as Silvages The wind inclined Easterly and rough tacked ship and went back into the Harbor of Gloucester.
The wind North North West And a very fresh breeze Thermometer 4 degrees below  zero. and Ice maing over the Harbor  layed allday at anchor without making any attempts to get under way
The wind about North North West Thermometer gone up to 10 above zero, fresh breeze and Easterly rote all day
The wind Northly West and although the Thermometer was only about 20 degrees above we did not make any effort to get under way. as it is reported the Wind was about North North East & very rough.

The wind N by. W. Thermometer 33 Got under way at 8 oclock in the fore noon passed out side of Thatchers Isle and tacked and stood up into Ipswich bay. Thook out reefs and set light sauls & headed to North ward & Eastward at sunset Isles of Shoels bore North about 5 miles distant passed out side of Isle of Shoals took the wind from the Northward & Easward Went into Portsmouth at midnight overcast

The wind N by. W. Thermometer 33 Got under way at 8 oclock in the fore noon passed out side of Thatchers Isle and tacked and stood up into Ipswich bay. Thook out reefs and set light sauls & headed to North ward & Eastward at sunset Isles of Shoels bore North about 5 miles distant passed out side of Isle of Shoals took the wind from the Northward & Easward Went into Portsmouth at midnight overcast

The wind N by. W. Thermometer 33 Got under way at 8 oclock in the fore noon passed out side of Thatchers Isle and tacked and stood up into Ipswich bay. Thook out reefs and set light sauls & headed to North ward & Eastward at sunset Isles of Shoels bore North about 5 miles distant passed out side of Isle of Shoals took the wind from the Northward & Easward Went into Portsmouth at midnight overcast

The wind N by. W. Thermometer 33 Got under way at 8 oclock in the fore noon passed out side of Thatchers Isle and tacked and stood up into Ipswich bay. Thook out reefs and set light sauls & headed to North ward & Eastward at sunset Isles of Shoels bore North about 5 miles distant passed out side of Isle of Shoals took the wind from the Northward & Easward Went into Portsmouth at midnight overcast

The wind North East Got under way in Portsmouth Schr A. G. Brooks for home. Got out by the Whales back and found it very rough gave it up and went back into Porthsmouth Sun out clean and Thermometer. 35, degrees above zero in the shade.

The wind N.N. West. and moderate. Got underway at day light. rough outside  Got abrest of York. at 10. A.M. and got becalmed. At two oclock the wind breezed up from South West very moderate and hauled westerly and Northerly at mid night nearby abrest Wood Island and becalmed. So ends these 24 hours.

The wind N.N. West. and moderate. Got underway at day light. rough outside  Got abrest of York. at 10. A.M. and got becalmed. At two oclock the wind breezed up from South West very moderate and hauled westerly and Northerly at mid night nearby abrest Wood Island and becalmed. So ends these 24 hours.

Calm or nearly sometill abrest 3 oclock in the afternoon when the wind breezed up South West The Thermometer 45 degrees above in the Shade. Passed Seguin outside at 5 P.M. Passed Monhegan at 8 PM the wind breezed up Passed Owls head at 11.30 P.M. and run for the Northern Head of Fox Island the sky overcast and look like a storm.

Calm or nearly sometill abrest 3 oclock in the afternoon when the wind breezed up South West The Thermometer 45 degrees above in the Shade. Passed Seguin outside at 5 P.M. Passed Monhegan at 8 PM the wind breezed up Passed Owls head at 11.30 P.M. and run for the Northern Head of Fox Island the sky overcast and look like a storm.

Thermometer midnight Anchored at Northern head of FoxIslands at 2 am at day light got underway for home Wind South West good breeze, and overcast with a little drizzling rain Running thraugh merchants row runinto thick ice and vessel stoped. Lowered boat took her under the bom and out the through ice more tahn one foot thick worked three hours and got  through it with the help of a smart breeze of wind. Went through Long Island head and got home at 4 oclock in the afternoon more maunatu

Thermometer midnight Anchored at Northern head of FoxIslands at 2 am at day light got underway for home Wind South West good breeze, and overcast with a little drizzling rain Running thraugh merchants row runinto thick ice and vessel stoped. Lowered boat took her under the bom and out the through ice more tahn one foot thick worked three hours and got  through it with the help of a smart breeze of wind. Went through Long Island head and got home at 4 oclock in the afternoon more maunatu

Thermometer midnight Anchored at Northern head of FoxIslands at 2 am at day light got underway for home Wind South West good breeze, and overcast with a little drizzling rain Running thraugh merchants row runinto thick ice and vessel stoped. Lowered boat took her under the bom and out the through ice more tahn one foot thick worked three hours and got  through it with the help of a smart breeze of wind. Went through Long Island head and got home at 4 oclock in the afternoon more maunatu
The wind Southerly commenced taking the corn out of the A.G. Brooks. that was put on board in Boston
The wind West North West Thermometer 39 degrees at noon in the shade. Finished taking the corn of the Schooner A.G. Brooks.
The wind East South East commenced making flying fibboon for Schr Lebanon. at 11 commenced snowing and raining went home Thermometer 32 degrees
The wind from South East to West rainy in forenoon and snow in afternoon Thermometer from 35 in forenoon down to 22 at night
The wind West North West Thermometer 24 degrees Wrote deed from Enoch Newman to Rufus H and Alexander Bickford
Wind Westerly Thermometer 29 above Finished the flying fibbon for the Schr Lebanon.
The wind East South East. Commenced snowing at 9 A.M. and snowed hard until dark at night wind came from North West Work apart of the day in J F Kingsleys shop turning for my self.
The wind North West Thermometer 20 above Work in the afternoon cutting fire wood
The wind Southerly Thermometer 28 above zero. Work about home
The wind Northerly Thermometer 32 degrees At home weighing hay for J. H. Kingsley & JennieTracy.
The wind very moderate Northerly Thermometer at noon. 37 degrees

The wind Easterly thermometer at noon 18 degrees above zero. Sent to the Town Clerk to get Mr Joseph Smallidge and Annie hammond Published, aslo in this Town and Town of Deer Isle Daniel McNeal of Gouldsbror and mifs Maria Tracy  Worked apart of the day for H E Tracy on Schr Lebanon
The wind Westerly Thermometer 35 above Workall day on fore boom for Schr Lebanon. The Sleighnig and sleding to day good as can be.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 40 above Worked in forenoon for H.E. Tracy and finished making fore boom Inafrernoon went on the head of home lot looking after fire wood at dark commenced raining.
The wind North West and blowing a very heavy gale all day with thermometer down to zero To cold to work out
The wind North West and wind very moderate but Thermometer down to zero in the morning and at noon went up to 15 above hauled wood all the afternoon
The wind North West Thermometer 10 above Went to West Gouldsboro accompanied by wife and child visiting and to see about taus. Stayed all night
The wind North West Thermometer 10 above Went to West Gouldsboro accompanied by wife and child visiting and to see about taus. Stayed all night
The wind Southerly Thermometer 35 degrees above at noon. Went home from West Gouldsboro in afternoon with A Bickford horse
The wind Southerly Thermometer 35 degrees above at noon. Went home from West Gouldsboro in afternoon with A Bickford horse

The wind South by East Thermometer 35 degree about 9 AM commenced to rain, and rained the remaindr of the day, and very late in the night. Reed the certificates of Joseph Smallidge and Daniel MC Neal from Clerk of this town

The wind East and Thermometer 34 degrees Rained very heavy all day with a fresh breeze Reed the certificate of Daniel MC Neal from the town of Deer Isle. of the Intention of Marriage. Turned caulking mallet for Herbert Tracy
The wind North East Thermometer 33 degrees above zero; Painted decoys for Thomas Bickford in the forenoon and commenced connecting two Bedrooms at home by putting a door between. Rainy
The wind Easterly. Thermometer 34 1/2 Went to Capt Nathan Bickfords visiting with my wife & child Snow and rain moderate all day Mary Jane Hammick baby died at 11 P.M.
The wind Easterly Thermometer 32 degrees snow squalls allday accompanied by rani cased out door cat home.
The wind Southerly and rough Thermometer 30 degrees above. The first Time shiny day since last Monday.
The wind NorthNorthEast and pleasant Thermometer 32 degrees above zero
The wind North Thermometer 43 degrees Started for Town Meeting. Went home and went to puthing up fence.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 42 degrees above zero at noon Worked 3/4 day for J F kingsley cutting Ice Hee commenced to day to cut ice

The wind South East Thermometer 37 degrees Worked in the forenoon for J. F Kingsley cutting Ice. At noon was notified that I was chosen a Constable at the annual Town Meeting held last monday. of which i was absent. In the afternoon work for Herbert Tracy putting in piece of wace in his vessel the Lebanon

The wind Easterly Thermometer 40 above Went on board of the Lebanon to work in the morning. at 9 AM it commenced raining and rained the remainder of the day. Was sworn as Constable by N. Hammond Justice of the Peace and sent the return to S.W. Libby Clerk of the Town of Gouldsboro.
The wind Easterly and rainy all day Thermometer 38 degrees work in the house fixing it up

The wind North East Thermometer 33 degrees Snow squalls untill 10 am and cleared up Had a small amount of plastering done in a bedroom in the forenoon and in the afternoon put Stem post in qawel boat of the Lebanon.
The wind moderate Northerly and sually overcast half of the day Thermometer 40

The wind East- North East Snow Squalls in the morning. Went to South Gouldsboro and put stem post in boat for C. L. Bunker Clerd of pleasant in forenoon Thermometer at night 35 degrees Walked home in the evening.

The wind East- North East Snow Squalls in the morning. Went to South Gouldsboro and put stem post in boat for C. L. Bunker Clerd of pleasant in forenoon Thermometer at night 35 degrees Walked home in the evening.

The wind East- North East Snow Squalls in the morning. Went to South Gouldsboro and put stem post in boat for C. L. Bunker Clerd of pleasant in forenoon Thermometer at night 35 degrees Walked home in the evening.
The wind North East in forenoon and Southerly in afternoon Mixed paint and painted the bedroom
The wind South East Thermometer 33 degrees Work in the forenoon for H E Tracy. In the afternoon weighed hay for Jennie Tracy
The wind Easterly Thermometer 38 degrees Wrote bill of sale of Barney Tioso Boat to J Winslow Joues & Co.
The wind Easterly Thermometer 38 dehrees Weighed hay for Jennie Tracy and worked on my dora
The wind East South East Thermometer 35 degrees rain and hailstorm all day. Ira B. Tioso captised in afternoon by Mr A .T. Palmer
The wind Southerly thermometer 42 degrees Work in the forenoon for Capt N.A. Bickford and in the afternoon on my dora Acknowledged deed for Hannoch M Hewman
Wind North West Thermometer 40 at noon Painted out side of dora in forenoon
Wind North West Thermometer 42 above made centre box for my dora sold and weighed hay for Chas Smith
The wind West North West Thermometer 45 degrees mailed nailed centre board box in dora and caulked it made thorts and painted the inside of dora
The wind West North West Thermometer 28 in morning and went up to 34 in afternoon
The wind West North West Thermometer 35 degrees Work about home made centre boad for my dora
Wind Westerly thermometer 41 degrees Took some straw matting and stove out the Hotel

The wind Easterly & clear Thermometer 45 above 0 Went to the Lower Harbor and filled out the application of Prize mooney for Clarinda H crane Whose late husband Lemul G Crane commanander of the W. S. Steamer Uncur during the Rebellion

The wind Easterly & clear Thermometer 45 above 0 Went to the Lower Harbor and filled out the application of Prize mooney for Clarinda H crane Whose late husband Lemul G Crane commanander of the W. S. Steamer Uncur during the Rebellion
The wind East North East blowing and snowing all day thermometer 32 degrees Put straw matting down on bedroom floor at home. Was appointed high way survayer by the Select men for this district

The wind very moderate Northerly in morning thick with snow. Went on the road and shoveled snow in forenoon wind hauled around Westerly Thermometer 46 taped a pair of boots for my self and worked on dora in afternoon for Geo. Pendleton Signed the quarterly returns for the Birch Harbor Post Master.

The wind West North West fresh breeze Thermometer at noon 38 degrees work in the forenoon for Geo. Pandleton and finished his dora Thermometer at dark 26 degrees In the evening Married Mr Daniel Mc Neal of Gouldsboro and mifs Maria Tracy of Deer Isle.
The wind West North West Thermometer 35 degrees.. at noon at freezing
The wind Westerly fresh breeze Thermometer in morning 22 degrees at noon warmer. Work most all day on a gun stock for Llewellyn Pendlton
Wind west North West Thermometer 40 degrees at noon Work in forenoon making a derick for the Schr A. G. Brooks. and in the afternoon worked on the Brooks repairing
The wind Westerly Thermometer 32 degrees commenced work in afternoon making fore gaft for Schr Nevada
Wind North West. Thermometer 42 degrees Finished making gaft for the Nevada in forenoon. Took the oath as highway surveyor of high ways. Lizzi Bunker sells Crow Island to E.A. Baker.
The wind Westerly Thermometer 30 work in forenoon finishe painting my dora
The wind South West Thermometer 60 degrees finished the gun stock and launched my dora
The wind South East and pleasant. thermometer 57 degrees
The wind Southerly Thermometer 38 degrees Tassed the all gangingCatecued herring net Wrote petition for EA Baker. to the Select Men
The wind North West in forenoon and South West in afternoon. Work allday on the Schr Ida G. Spafford for Capt James A. Stevens
Calm in morning then the wind breezed up South East . Thermometer 41 Work all day aboit home on trall
The wind North East light snow in the morning then turned to drizzling rain Roped dora sail and geting ready to go fishing
The wind North East. and a perfect gale of wind with snow hail and rain allday. at night the snow not more than three inches deep and raining hard thermometer 32 degrees made net buoys
The wind West South West Thermometer 44 degrees in the afternoon. Riged trall morings and lined dora sail turned thole pins&c.
The wind North West and very pleasant Thermometer 50 degrees Stephen Torrey died at 5 oclock in the morning
The wind North West Thermometer 50 degrees hauled wood from Baker & Smiths store for my self
The wind North west Thermometer 39 degrees bailed trall ready to go fishing tomorrow Stephan Torrey burried in afternoon a prayer at the house by A.T. Palmer

The wind Northerly in morning went out fishing for the first time for the season got 9 wind Southerly at noon came home. Thermometer 35 degrees Jennie Hammond burried in afternoon Seruises at the house by A T Palmer

The wind Southerly in morning and the Termometer below freezing Went to the Lower Harbor claming for bait. The wind came North West and blew fresh put sail on dora and beat home in afternoon the Thermometer 50 above Caused Repairs in cross way in ligh ways

Calm in morning went out fishing picked the troll twice got 14 fish at noon the wind breezed up South west and came home. Wrote Notice for District meeting in district No. 12 which is at the Lower Harbor Thermometer 37.
The wind South West and chilly raw Thermometer 42 degrees work on dora for a Mr. Pitlee of Brooklin put in center board
The wind Southerly Thermometer 41 degrees in forenoon Late in the afternoon wind Westerly and very pleasant and the Thermometer 50.

The wind North west and pleasant with Thermometer 65 degrees at noon Finished labor on one dora for Mr Petlee of Brooklin and commenced on an other one for his son Filled application for Baker & Smith to cary on business in manufature tobacco. Acknowledged Bill of Sale for A. J. Gerrish Wrote lease from Isaac P Joy to Amasink Southard recd check from the P.O. Department to Cary mail on route 365
The wind Southerly work allday on dora Thermometer 60
The wind Easterly Thermometer 49 at noon Went to Bunkers Harbor and bought a set of Chira dishes for Annie Smallidge of Mrs Emma Emerson work on dora in afternoon
The wind Easterly Thermometer 49 at noon Went to Bunkers Harbor and bought a set of Chira dishes for Annie Smallidge of Mrs Emma Emerson work on dora in afternoon
The wind Easterly Thermometer 49 at noon Went to Bunkers Harbor and bought a set of Chira dishes for Annie Smallidge of Mrs Emma Emerson work on dora in afternoon
The wind Southerly Thermometer 61 degrees at noon Got Ira B. Foss & A. J. Gerrish to sign my bond as constable Wm Handys note was taken up amount of $ 50 and int

The wind South East and rainy. Wrote deed for Abbie L Harrington to Mrs D. M. Summer thermometer 38 Left sum noons for Simon J. Angbrews to apeer at a justice Court and answer to Curtis Stevens of Castine
The wind North West Thermometer 50 work on doras
The wind Southerly Thermometer 49 not well all day
Wind South South East and forenoon rainy thermometer 37 degrees not well unable to work.
The wind North West Thermometer 65 degrees Annie Smallidge moved in one part of the house

Calm in morning Went to Prospect with the Stage dosee E.W. Cleaves about filling a justice writ to rebion Wind Southerly in afternoon Walked home Thermometer 61 degrees wrote deed from Peleg L Tracy to David Weare.

Calm in morning Went to Prospect with the Stage dosee E.W. Cleaves about filling a justice writ to rebion Wind Southerly in afternoon Walked home Thermometer 61 degrees wrote deed from Peleg L Tracy to David Weare.

Calm in morning Went to Prospect with the Stage dosee E.W. Cleaves about filling a justice writ to rebion Wind Southerly in afternoon Walked home Thermometer 61 degrees wrote deed from Peleg L Tracy to David Weare.
Wind Westerly and Thermometer 65 degrees above zero Work about home doing various kinds of work
Wind South East Thermometer 33 moved Geo. Gerrish from the fish house to the one recently bought by Mark Joy. In afternoon made made sink for room occupied by Joseph & Annie Smallidge
Wind Southerly thermometer 42 degrees work apart of the day setling up sink & building meat chest Helped J.F. Kingsley mark his lamles & c
Wind South South East Thermometer 52 degrees pleasant
The wind South Easterly and showery. build fence out of barb wire to step up E.A. Bakers cattle Thermometer 41 degrees
The wind Southerly Thermometer 49 degrees Sawed out whul barrow side for my self
The wind South Easterly fogg and rainy apart of the day.
The wind South East made wheel for Isaacs Joys wheel barrow in forenoon and in the afternoon work for E.A. Baker laying floorin his store Thermometer 52
Wind moderate Southerly made head for a wheel barrow fo my self Thermometer 58

The wind Northerly in forenoon Went out fishing and found my hall parted and the most of it lost. Took up the moorings and one end of trace swept for the rest but could not find it. Wind South west in afternoon came home. Mr Timathy Damton burried in afternoon Thermometer 60 degrees brought potatoes out of the cellar to pick our
The wind South East Thermometer 60 degrees overcast
Wind North East and afternoon rainy Thermometer 55 degrees work about home all day fresh breeze
Wind East and blowing a gale with atremendious heavy rain all day with out ceasing Thermometer 50 degrees Commenced rigging trall in place one I lost.
The wind East North East Thermometer 45 rainy all day fresh breeze Finished rigging my troll.
Wind East and a gale tremendious rain all day. Thermometer 40 Work apart of the day for Almia Bourgett Wrote Notices for Jennie Tracy warning people to take care of their cattle
Wind Easterly and heavy rain work apart of the day for my slef on henpan Thermometer 39
The wind North East Thermometer 42 degrees wind moderate but the rain very heavy work all day on hen pew for my self
The wind hauled around Northward and in the afternoon sun came out very pleasant. Went to Herm Island to see E.A.Bakers wier. Thermometer 69 degrees.
very light rain Northerly went out fishing and to sweep for my lost troll but did not get it. Wind Southerly in afternoon and fogy came home but left a new troll out there to catch the lost one.
The wind South West Thermometer 49 degrees went to Bar Harbor after bait but got none. came back home in the afternoon.
The wind South West Thermometer 49 degrees went to Bar Harbor after bait but got none. came back home in the afternoon.
The wind South West Thermometer 49 degrees went to Bar Harbor after bait but got none. came back home in the afternoon.
Very moderate in the morning went out to my troll. The wind struck from the North East in a aquall and blowed a gale cast the troll of and came home Thermometer 47 degrees.
The wind Easterly and hauled around Southerly went out fishing and got my lost troll by hauling it up on the one I was fishing with Thermometer 57 Had organ put in house
The wind Southerly and fogy went out to my troll fog cleared up about 10 am. Calm in afternon rowed all the way in Thermometer 53 degrees
The wind North East in morning and hauled around Easterly Southerly and S.W. went out fishing all day. Thermometer at night 49 degrees
The wind Southerly and in the forenoon very pleasant with the Thermometer 63 In the afternoon cloudy at 4 PM commenced raining
The wind Southerly Not having any bait did not go to my troll but warked about home Thermometer 65 degrees
Wind Easterly and thick with fog. Went to my troll with out any bait and took of what fish there was on it. afternoon cleared up with the Thermometer 57 degrees
Wind Easterly not having any bait did not go to my troll but worked about home
The wind South East Thermometer 67 degrees Commenced farming done all ploving Recd execution against J. L. Andrews for me to collect as Constable from the Office of Geo M Warren G. Stevens Plaintiff
The wind Easterly hauled out dressing to plant and harrewed out friell Thermometer 40
The wind North East fresh breeze and heavy rain all day. work apart of the day on wheel barrow. and examined the papers of Wm. Bunkers for carrying the mail
The wind Southerly fresh breeze but pleasant Went to So. Gouldsboro with J. F. Kingsley Thermometer 68 degrees
The wind Southerly fresh breeze but pleasant Went to So. Gouldsboro with J. F. Kingsley Thermometer 68 degrees
The wind Southerly fresh breeze but pleasant Went to So. Gouldsboro with J. F. Kingsley Thermometer 68 degrees
Wind North West Thermometer 59 Put centre board in boat from Capt Ephrain Alley
The wind South West work all day farming with J.F.Kingsleys horse and the help of Geo. Gerrish Finished hauling out dressing and planted corn beans & c. Thermometer 50
The Wind South Easterly and overcast and in the afternoon thick with fog and looked like rain Thermometer 47 degrees Finished planting potatoes
The wind North by East in forenoon clear and pleasant Work in forenoon on garden. In afternoon wind South East. Went out and took up my troll Thermometer 61

Wind Easterly with fresh breeze. Filled out Notices and sent them to all Tax payers notifying them of the amount of their tax on high way & the date and place of commencing work my self being the Highway surveyer at night commenced raining Thermometer 57 degrees
The wind E. S. East and pleasant Thermometer 62 degrees bought of James A Stevens 2 Hds salt and got it a shore finished sewing garden and all farming for the spring Recd letter from J.H.West
The wind Southerly moderate and pleasant Thermometer 60
The wind Southerly and in the forenoon thick with fog. Commenced working on the Hoghway on new road my self surveyor. Thermometer 47

The wind Southerly and thick with fog all day Went to Franklin with Wm Sargents horse to see about going in the Sea Queencame home at night S. C. Pendleton duty sworn surveyor protem untill I got ready to take charge Thermometer 64 degrees
The wind came off from the North West in the morning. and the fog left. Good fresh breeze. Worked on road all day. from foot of Mr. Newmans Hill to the Post. Office. Thermometer 58
The wind North West and fresh breeze Thermometer down to 50 degrees. Work on the roads all day. from the Post Office to Amaziah Southards
The wind South West Work about home Thermometer 59
The wind So: West Thermometer 55 Work about home Grinding tools getting ready to go to Sullivan to work on the Schr Sea Queen
The wind Southerly and showery Went to Spetacle Island after bait Thermometer 52
The wind Southerly and showery Went to Spetacle Island after bait Thermometer 52
The wind Southerly and showery Went to Spetacle Island after bait Thermometer 52
Calm in morning went out fishing and and in the afternon Wind Southerly came home. At night Showery. Thermometer 56 degrees
The wind North West washed out some Cod fish headed up salt dried trolls nets & c to put away Thermometer 57 degrees
The wind North West washed out haddock and put fish on the flaker. In the afternoon went with my sister fining up the graves of our Father & Brother. Thermometer 62 degrees
Wind North West in forenoon Work in forenoon for J. H. Smallidge on front yard fence In the afternoon Wind Southerly work for my self on out building Thermometer 68
The wind North West in forenoon . Work all day for J. H. Smallidge on Schr A.G. Brooks gawl boat Wind Southerly in the afternoon. Thunder shower Thermometer 72

Calm in morning Went to W. Gouldsboro to see S. L. Tracy and in the afternoon getting ready to go to Sullivan to work on Schr Sea queen expected to go in her after she is repaired Thermometer at noon 70 degrees Wind Southerly in afternoon

Calm in morning Went to W. Gouldsboro to see S. L. Tracy and in the afternoon getting ready to go to Sullivan to work on Schr Sea queen expected to go in her after she is repaired Thermometer at noon 70 degrees Wind Southerly in afternoon

Calm in morning Went to W. Gouldsboro to see S. L. Tracy and in the afternoon getting ready to go to Sullivan to work on Schr Sea queen expected to go in her after she is repaired Thermometer at noon 70 degrees Wind Southerly in afternoon

Calm in the forenoon Thermometer 72 degrees At noon the wind breezed up Southerly Started for Sullivan in my dora with tools bedding & c to go on board the Sea queen arrived at Sullivan at 3 1/2 oclock not finding the vessel walked to Franklin to see the owners and learned the vessel had not got back from her trip Then I walked back to Sullivan got there at dark and stoped through the night on board the Steamer Mt Desert

Calm in the forenoon Thermometer 72 degrees At noon the wind breezed up Southerly Started for Sullivan in my dora with tools bedding & c to go on board the Sea queen arrived at Sullivan at 3 1/2 oclock not finding the vessel walked to Franklin to see the owners and learned the vessel had not got back from her trip Then I walked back to Sullivan got there at dark and stoped through the night on board the Steamer Mt Desert
Calm in ther forenoon and Wind West South West in the afternoon Got the knees ready to put in at three oclock got in dora and started for home Landed at Hoss shore at 5 and walked home
Wind Southerly and pleasant
Celebration day Calm and very pleasant in forenoon and in the afternoon Wind southerly and some very heavy showers

moderate Westerly in forenoon Went to So. Gouldsboro accompanied by my wife and went to dora to stop on board the Sea Queen the remainder of the week while repairing arrived a little past noon work in the afternoon on the Schr Sea Queen

moderate Westerly in forenoon Went to So. Gouldsboro accompanied by my wife and went to dora to stop on board the Sea Queen the remainder of the week while repairing arrived a little past noon work in the afternoon on the Schr Sea Queen

Calm in the forenoon and very hot but not having any Thermometer on board caued not Tittl how hot it is. Worked all the forenoon on the vessel and in the afternoon the wind breezed up Southerly. Got in the dora with my wife and started for home. Canded in Hosses Cove and walked home arrived at Sunset.
The wind Southerly with a very fresh breeze at 4 P.M.  left home for Sullivan went to Fosses shore took the dora and arrived on board the Sea Queen at sunset in Sullivan

Wind Southerly & overcast Healed the vessel on this beach to clean and coulk the caulkers finished one side. At 2. P.M. vessel floated hauled along side of wharf & at three got in dora and started for home at 4. P.M. heavy rain and blow at 6 PM tremendious rain with a gale of wind southerly with thunder & lightning landed at MartinMyricks at 7 Pm and walked home arrived at dark

The wind North West heavy breeze left home at 3 P.M. walked up to Martin Myricks shore got in dora and started for Sullivan strong Ebb licle & heavy North West wind arrived on board with Sea Queen at Sullivan at ten oclock P.M.
Wind Southerly and showery laid in Winter Harbor
Wind Southerly and thick with fog all day filled water and getting ready to sail
The wind S.S. East and blowing heavy with heavy rain all day

Wrote notice for dis. meeting The wind Easterly and thick with fog work at home in the garden the ground very wet. Annie Smallidge moved out of the house Wrote Notice for a Disctrict Meeting by a petition of 5 words
Wind out Southerly no chance to go away in vessel Staid at home hoed corn beans & c
Very moderate all day the sun shining by spells but the fog very dence Work all the forenoon on the vessels Yawl boat and in the afternoon painted the vessels wait out side
Calm all day Fog cleared up a little while in the Harbor made lower pump box for the Sea Queen
Fog cleared up over the land but thick out side and calm Tried to get out the Harbor but could not

Wind Southerly and thick with fog underway in the morning and tried to get out but not wind enough to get by the Harpor point and anchored in Sargents cove In the afternoon wind breezed up Southerly Started again to go out got down as far as Neads Island and the fog so thick gave it up and went back and anchored in the Sand cove
The wind North West and pleasant
